definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general

sentences.english: He sometimes has a grand piano on the set.
sentences.chinese: 有時他在攝影棚裏放一架大鋼琴。

sentences.english: In the middle of the room was the grand piano with two round stools.
sentences.chinese: 在房間的中央中是有二個回合凳子的大鋼琴。

sentences.english: The piano soon developed into the contemporary nine- to ten-foot concert grand.
sentences.chinese: 不久鋼琴就發展到同時代的九到十英尺的平臺大鋼琴。

sentences.english: They coaxed the grand piano through the door.
sentences.chinese: 他們小心翼翼地把大鋼琴搬進門裏去。

sentences.english: Our grand piano is in good tune.
She struck up the first carol on the grand piano .
sentences.chinese: 她開始在那架大鋼琴上演奏起第一首頌歌。

sentences.english: It is a bit like tuning a grand piano at the same time you are being taught to practice scales.
sentences.chinese: 這好比在調整大鋼琴位同時您正在教實踐尺度。
